title: How the Supreme Court’s Ruling Could Revive Some Contested Trump Policies
summary: The Supreme Court has imposed new limits on the power of district-court judges. Here’s what that means for the Trump administration.

title: How the Birthright Citizenship and Nationwide Injunctions Case Began
summary: The dispute before the court was prompted by an order President Trump signed on his first day back in the White House.

title: University of Virginia President Resigns Under Pressure From Trump Administration
summary: The Justice Department had demanded that James E. Ryan step down in order to help resolve a civil rights investigation into the school.

title: G7 Backs Plan for ‘Side-by-Side’ Tax System to Avoid U.S. Fight
summary: American companies will be exempt from penalties related to a 2021 global minimum tax deal that President Trump opposes.

title: Newsom Sues Fox News for at Least $787 Million Over Trump Phone Call Coverage
summary: The lawsuit, which seeks at least $787 million in damages, comes as the California governor adopts an increasingly combative style with the president and his allies.

title: Supreme Court Requires Schools to Allow Opting Out From LGBTQ Stories
summary: Maryland parents have a religious right to withdraw their children from classes on days that stories with gay and transgender themes are discussed, the court ruled.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Preventive Care Provision in Affordable Care Act
summary: The case stemmed from a lawsuit brought by conservatives seeking to block free preventive care, including medicine to prevent H.I.V. transmission.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Texas Law Requiring Age Verification on Pornography Sites
summary: The law, meant to shield minors from sexual materials on the internet by requiring adults to prove they are at least 18, was challenged on First Amendment grounds.

title: Supreme Court Punts Decision on Louisiana Voting Map Until Next Term
summary: The justices asked that the case, which has implications for the political power of Black voters, be reargued next term.

title: Cuomo Doesn’t Blame Himself for Losing the Primary. Others Do.
summary: Even some of his supporters say Andrew M. Cuomo ran an aloof campaign for mayor that underestimated his chief rival, Zohran Mamdani.

title: Major Unions Are Dropping Cuomo to Back Mamdani in N.Y.C. Mayor’s Race
summary: The powerful hotel workers union and Local 32BJ are switching their endorsements to Zohran Mamdani, a sign that Democratic power brokers are coalescing behind him.

title: The Concorde-and-Caviar Era of Condé Nast, When Magazines Ruled the Earth
summary: Opulent days are over at Vogue, Vanity Fair and other once-powerful glossies. Anna Wintour is giving up (some) control. Now that everyone’s a gatekeeper, why do we keep recreating their status-obsessed world?

title: El Salvador Police Say Quotas and Rumors Fueled Bukele’s Mass Arrests
summary: Tens of thousands of people were jailed as part of President Nayib Bukele crackdown on gangs. Some police officers now admit they arrested people on flimsy or nonexistent evidence to meet quotas.

title: Authorities Rescue Girl Whose Mother Livestreamed Her Sexual Abuse
summary: The 9-year-old from Vietnam was abused by her mother for customers watching on smartphone apps in the U.S. and elsewhere. The mother said she needed the money.

title: Israel Suggests It Could Strike Iran Again to Counter New Threats
summary: Israel’s defense minister said Israel would strike if Iran seeks to develop long-range missiles or advance its nuclear program, despite a truce.

title: How Trump Upended 60 Years of Civil Rights in Two Months
summary: An assault on federal protections may bring about a new era of unchecked discrimination.

title: Rachel Zegler’s Balcony Scene in ‘Evita’ Has London Talking
summary: Crowds are converging outside the London Palladium to watch Rachel Zegler sing “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina” from a balcony — while paying theatergoers inside see it on a screen.

title: The Supreme Court’s Intolerable Ruling on Birthright Citizenship
summary: The court didn’t rule on the legality of Trump’s order, but it didn’t have to.

title: The Internet Needs Sex
summary: And an internet without it is one that offers a pale shadow of human potential and possibility.

title: The Century’s Best Movies
summary: We compiled the list by polling more than 500 people in and around the film industry.

title: Getty Villa Is Reopening in Los Angeles After Palisades Fire
summary: Although the museum’s artwork was unscathed, roughly 1,400 trees on the property burned during the Palisades fire. Visible traces of the devastation are intentional.

title: Critical Hurricane Monitoring Data Is Going Offline
summary: The loss of access to the data could hamstring forecasters’ ability to track hurricanes and warn residents of their risk.

title: Rick Hurst, Cletus Hogg on ‘The Dukes of Hazzard,’ Dies at 79
summary: As the affable deputy sheriff on the popular CBS show, Mr. Hurst became a beloved figure for many fans of the show.

title: A Runestone That May Be North America’s Oldest Turns Up in a Canada Forest
summary: Researchers spent years quietly studying a stone carved with 255 runes and the image of a boat found in Ontario. Now, revealing the stone’s existence, they’re asking the public for help.
